chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: The LORD is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? the LORD is the strength of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?
items.plainText: The LORD is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? the LORD is the strength of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?

items.text: When the wicked, even mine enemies and my foes, came upon me to eat up my flesh, they stumbled and fell.
items.plainText: When the wicked, even mine enemies and my foes, came upon me to eat up my flesh, they stumbled and fell.

items.text: Though an host should encamp against me, my heart shall not fear: though war should rise against me, in this will I be confident.
items.plainText: Though an host should encamp against me, my heart shall not fear: though war should rise against me, in this will I be confident.

items.text: One thing have I desired of the LORD, that will I seek after; that I may dwell in the house of the LORD all the days of my life, to behold the beauty of the LORD, and to enquire in his temple.
items.plainText: One thing have I desired of the LORD, that will I seek after; that I may dwell in the house of the LORD all the days of my life, to behold the beauty of the LORD, and to enquire in his temple.

items.text: For in the time of trouble he shall hide me in his pavilion: in the secret of his tabernacle shall he hide me; he shall set me up upon a rock.
items.plainText: For in the time of trouble he shall hide me in his pavilion: in the secret of his tabernacle shall he hide me; he shall set me up upon a rock.

items.text: And now shall mine head be lifted up above mine enemies round about me: therefore will I offer in his tabernacle sacrifices of joy; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises unto the LORD.
items.plainText: And now shall mine head be lifted up above mine enemies round about me: therefore will I offer in his tabernacle sacrifices of joy; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises unto the LORD.

items.text: Hear, O LORD, when I cry with my voice: have mercy also upon me, and answer me.
items.plainText: Hear, O LORD, when I cry with my voice: have mercy also upon me, and answer me.

items.text: When thou saidst, Seek ye my face; my heart said unto thee, Thy face, LORD, will I seek.
items.plainText: When thou saidst, Seek ye my face; my heart said unto thee, Thy face, LORD, will I seek.

items.text: Hide not thy face far from me; put not thy servant away in anger: thou hast been my help; leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.
items.plainText: Hide not thy face far from me; put not thy servant away in anger: thou hast been my help; leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.

items.text: When my father and my mother forsake me, then the LORD will take me up.
items.plainText: When my father and my mother forsake me, then the LORD will take me up.

items.text: Teach me thy way, O LORD, and lead me in a plain path, because of mine enemies.
items.plainText: Teach me thy way, O LORD, and lead me in a plain path, because of mine enemies.

items.text: Deliver me not over unto the will of mine enemies: for false witnesses are risen up against me, and such as breathe out cruelty.
items.plainText: Deliver me not over unto the will of mine enemies: for false witnesses are risen up against me, and such as breathe out cruelty.

items.text: I had fainted, unless I had believed to see the goodness of the LORD in the land of the living.
items.plainText: I had fainted, unless I had believed to see the goodness of the LORD in the land of the living.

items.text: Wait on the LORD: be of good courage, and he shall strengthen thine heart: wait, I say, on the LORD.
items.plainText: Wait on the LORD: be of good courage, and he shall strengthen thine heart: wait, I say, on the LORD.
